definition: to close (a door)/to turn off (light, electrical equipment etc)
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]

sentences.english: I closed the window. I combed his long, black hair from his forehead.
sentences.chinese: 我关上窗，为他梳理了额头长长的黑发。

sentences.english: Also, we can finally turn the spotlights off.
sentences.chinese: 此外，我们也终于能关上那盏聚光灯了。

sentences.english: Sitting at his toll booth one day, the publican saw Jesus approaching.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，马太坐在税关上，看见耶稣向他走来。

sentences.english: If the car door is pushed aside, ask the locked passengers to close the door.
sentences.chinese: 如轿门已被扒开，让被困乘客关上轿门。

sentences.english: On one of many cold frosty nights, I shut my caravan door behind me and took a step out into the darkness.
sentences.chinese: 在一个寒冷的霜夜，我关上房车的门，慢慢步入黑暗。

sentences.english: The house was empty and shuttered.
sentences.chinese: 这所房子是空的，窗板都关上了。

sentences.english: A continuous beep sounds while the door is closing.
sentences.chinese: 当机门正在关上时，会有一个连续响声。

sentences.english: Her mother yells: Close the door.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲尖声叫道，“把门关上。”

sentences.english: His guards shut the doors and not to listen.
sentences.chinese: 于是他把所有卫兵都遣走，关上殿门。

sentences.english: Megan closed the door behind them and turned the lights on.
sentences.chinese: 梅金走在最后面，是她关上了门，也是她开的灯。

sentences.english: He wrote nothing, and the books were closed.
sentences.chinese: 他什么都不写了，书本全关上了。

sentences.english: You can toss it under the bed, turn out the light, and head into dreamland.
sentences.chinese: 把它丢到床底下，关上灯，进入你自己的梦乡。

sentences.english: Then he turned a switch and the voices stopped.
sentences.chinese: 他于是关上电门，说话声音就中断了。

sentences.english: The tap is on, and won't be stopped until late afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 水头龙正开着，下午晚些时候才会关上。

sentences.english: Will you shut the door, if you please?
He goes even leaves his front door unlocked.
sentences.chinese: 他走的时候连门都没有关上。

definition: door of a room
to stand as a goalkeeper/to keep guard on a gate
to lock/to lock up
to close (box, book, mouth etc)
to push open (a gate etc)/to push away/to reject/to decline
to switch off/to shut off
locked in (with the door locked from the outside)
outside the door
to close securely/tightly closed/secure
to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
to leave/to walk away/to beat it/to move aside
window/CL:個|个[ge4],扇[shan4]
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
window
